choices.B: Use a new change set to deploy metadata and data from the sandbox to production.
choices.D: Add permissions and access settings to the outbound change set.
choices.C: Clone the change set to add dependent components to an uploaded change set.
choices.E: Edit the uploaded change set to add the additional components.

discussion.content: ACD. B is incorrect as change sets can only move metadata, not data, to another org.

comments.content: I agree, and it's not possible to edit a change set, so also E is incorrect

discussion.content: ACD. You can't deploy data and you need to clone the change set if this one has already been uploaded

Selected Answer: ACD
The answer is A, C, D.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is moving sandbox customizations to production using a change set. After creating the initial change set, the administrator realizes that some components were missed.
What three considerations should the Admin make regarding the change set? (Choose three.)

choices.D: Make the zone field required on the page layout.
choices.C: Create a validation rule using ISBLANK().
choices.A: Set default values for both picklist fields.
choices.B: Make both picklist fields required at the field level.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C
D is correct. tested it and it worked

comments.content: If you make it required just on the page layout, you can let it blank if you load data by API or using dataloader
Zone has to be required only if region is selected.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
D cannot be correct as Zone is required only when Region was selected.
Answer is D. Make the zone field required on the page layout.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers has set up a picklist dependency between region and zone on the Account object. The sales manager has requested that when a user selects a region, a zone must also be selected.
How should this be achieved?

questions.answer_description:
Filter-Based Opportunity Territory can indicate that a territory type is the highest priority or the lowest.
Reference:
https://resources.docs.salesforce.com/latest/latest/en-us/sfdc/pdf/salesforce_implementing_territory_mgmt2_guide.pdf

choices.B: Territory hierarchy replaces the role hierarchy for sharing.
choices.D: Prioritize territories to indicate highest priority or lowest priority.
choices.A: The ability to use 20 territories assignment rules per model.
choices.C: The ability to use filter-based opportunity criteria to expand assignment rules.

questions.answer_description:
When an agent accepts the work and then edits and saves the work item record, automation rules are triggered.
Reference:
https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=sf.omnichannel_routing.htm&type=5

choices.D: If there is a tie in the Omni-Channel routing logic, Omni-Channel routes the work to the agent who most recently received a work item.
choices.B: The least active routing model looks for the agent who has the largest maximum work capacity.
choices.C: Assignment rules are triggered when an agent accepts the work and edits and saves the work.
choices.A: Assignment rules are triggered when Omni-Channel routing routes a work item to an agent and the agent accepts the work.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants to use the Omni-Channel routing feature in Service Cloud. They are using assignment rules and want to ensure that the routing chosen meets the requirements.
What should an administrator take into consideration before implementation?

discussion.content:
Not AC - because it is automation rules that run after the work item is saved by the agent. The options says Assignment Rules and Not Automation rules. 

B - is the definition for Most available. So this option is out.
Answer D : 
But what if there’s a tie between two or more agents? In that case, Omni-Channel routes the work to the agent who received a work item the longest ago

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.omnichannel_routing.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: C
As the link on the given answer explains:
"Automation rules, such as assignment, auto-response, escalation, and workflow rules, AREN'T triggered when Omni-Channel routes a work item to an agent and the agent accepts the work.

When an agent accepts the work and then edits and saves the work item record, automation rules ARE triggered.'

A. Assignment rules are triggered when Omni-Channel routing routes a work item to an agent and the agent accepts the work.

This statement is correct. When a work item is routed to an agent using Omni-Channel routing, it is first evaluated against any active assignment rules to determine which agent or queue should receive the work. Once the work item is routed to an agent and the agent accepts the work, the assignment rule is triggered.

Selected Answer: D
If you created sandbox-only users, then they no longer exist. https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.data_sandbox_accessing_sandbox.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: D
Users in the sandbox that do not exist in production will be erased.
For answer B, metadata changes since last refresh will be erased and only production metadata will be copied to the sandbox.
So the answer is D

should be answer B Because Refreshing a sandbox updates its metadata from the source org. If the sandbox is a clone or if it uses a sandbox template, the refresh process updates the org’s data and its metadata.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?language=en_US&id=sf.data_sandbox_refresh.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: D
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.data_sandbox_accessing_sandbox.htm&type=5

"A sandbox refresh deletes and recreates the sandbox as a copy of the production org. This process reverses any manual access changes you made. If you created sandbox-only users, then they no longer exist. Other users’ profile and permissions revert to their values in the production org."

Selected Answer: B
C is not correct as ALL data can ve relevant only for full sandbox. Question does not define sandbox type thus only metadata is always a part of changeset.

questions.question_text: After an administrator has refreshed a sandbox, what behavior should users expect to see in the sandbox?

choices.A: Users in production will now be able to receive emails sent out from the sandbox.
choices.D: Users in the sandbox that do not exist in production will no longer exist in the sandbox.
choices.C: All new data since the last refresh will be added to the existing information in the sandbox.
choices.B: Metadata changes since the last refresh will be added to the existing information in the sandbox.
